generic.supportdesc: Your donation will be crucial in covering our administrative expenses. This will help us through this tough times where we can’t organise any competitions.
generic.refreshmessage: Refresh the page to update the content
generic.errordesc: There was an error while submitting results! Please, try again and if the error persists contact the organizers.

live.title: Livestream Schedule
live.desc: The Cubing in Spring 2021 will be entirely streamed on Cubing Italy's Twitch channel. Fast solves, games, interviews and much more!
extra: DISCLAIMER: The livestream will be in Italian
live.descextra: The Cubing in Spring 2021 will be entirely streamed on Cubing Italy's Twitch channel!

faq.title: FAQ
faq.desc: Here are the Frequently Asked Question!

entries.question: How do I register?
steps: Go to the official page of the WCA WCA and make a new account. If you already have one you can skip this step.
Sign into this website by using your WCA account.
Click on Register in the menu on the left and choose the events in which you’d like to compete.

entries.question: Can I change the events I wish to compete in?
answer: Yes, you can edit your submission until the end of registration period.

entries.question: How long is the registration period?
answer: Registration period is from 14:00 (GMT+2) of May 10th 2021 to 23:59 (GMT+2) of May 20th 2021.

entries.question: Do I have to pay a registration fee?
answer: No, the competition is free and open to everyone.

entries.question: How fast do I need to be to take part in this competition?
answer: There are no requirements. Everybody can take part in the event and have fun.

entries.question: When do I have to submit my solves?
answer: You can submit your solves in these two time frames:

entries.question: Where do I find the scrambles?
answer: You will find the scrambles in a dedicated section during the competition days.

entries.question: Where do I find the standings?
answer: You will be able to see the standings in a dedicated section during the competition days.

entries.question: Do I need to record myself?
answer: A video proof will be demanded only for whoever gets on the podium, so if you think you could make it on the podium, make sure to record yourself!
If you forget to record yourself and still manage to podium, you won’t be banned from the competition, but just excluded from the official podiums list.

entries.question: How do I take part in the live event?
answer: We will get in touch with the best competitors after the first rounds. If you think you can get a top spot, clear your schedule for Sunday afternoon!
If someone declines the invite, we will ask the next person in the standings until we fill our slots.

entries.question: Are the Discord voice channels free to join?
answer: Yes, just click the link in the top right corner and join our server.

entries.question: I can’t compete on that weekend, will there be other events in the future?
answer: Of course, don’t worry. Follow us on social media too keep in touch with all the news.

info.title: General Info
info.desc: The Cubing in Spring 2021 will take place on May 22nd and 23rd!

sections.title: Registration
sections.desc: From 14:00 of May 10th to 23:59 of May 20th
messages: You will be allowed to submit results only in the events in which you are registered. Be careful when filling the registration form.

sections.title: Dates
messages: First rounds will be on Saturday while all the finals will be on Sunday. Only the best from the first rounds will qualify.
You can submit your times in the Results section which will be accessible only during the days of the competition.

sections.title: Results
messages: You can submit your results in any order you like during these two time frames:
postmessages: At the end of both days you'll be able to view the rankings in a dedicated section on this site.

sections.title: Video proof
messages: We will ask for video proof of the solves only if you secure a spot on the podium. If you think you have your chances of winning, don’t forget to record yourself.
We will consider valid only videos that don’t present cuts or any other form of editing: start the recording before scrambling for the first attempt and stop it after you have finished your average.

You can send us the video through our social media, via email or in any other way that suits you. If the file size is too large, we suggest you upload the video to youtube as “unlisted” and share the link with us.
If you fail to provide said proof, you will be excluded from the final podium but not from the competition.

live.title: Livestream
live.twitchdesc: We will be live on Cubing Italy's Twitch channel during the whole competition streaming live solves, interviews, games and much more. We will submit a detailed program of the event when registrations open.
live.discorddesc: We set up a few voice channels on Speedcubing.it's Discord server. Join them to do your solves with your friends or meet new members of the community!

rules.title: Rules
desc: You should follow the WCA regulations as strictly as possible.
Here are the most important ones:
rules: Time your solves with a stackmat (the official WCA timer used during competitions) and using up to 15s of inspection.
If you don't own a stackmat you can time your solves with your phone or computer using CS Timer.
Penalties should be applied as per the WCA rules.
You must use the scrambles provided in the Results section to do your solves.
You are given extra scrambles for each turn. If you get distracted during your solution simply swap the time with the one done on the extra scramble.

register.title: Registration
register.desc: Registrations will open on the 10th of May

regformopen.title: Choose the events you would like to register for.
regformopen.desc: You can edit your registration until May 20th, 23:59 (GMT+2).

regformclosed.title: These are the events you registered for
regformclosed.desc: You will find the scrambles in the Results page

regsteps: Visit the WCA website and create a new account. If you already have one you can skip this step.
Log in this site through your WCA account.
Choose the events you wish to compete in on this page.

compete.title: Submit your results
instructions: Enter the times of the event in the XX:YY.ZZ format. Any error in the process will be reported.
Remember to check the DNF box (Did not finish) in the cases listed in the WCA Regulations.
If necessary, add any WCA penalties you have committed to your time before entering it. Eg.: 18.89 + 2 = 20.89.
Once you have entered all your times, the calculation of the average (if the event foresees it) will be automatic.

You can send the results in the order you prefer at any time during these dedicated slots:
  • First round. Saturday: 10 am to 6 pm (GMT+2)
  • Finals. Sunday: from 10 am to 8 pm (GMT+2)
Once the results of an event have been sent, it will no longer be possible to change them. Double check before submitting!
At the end of each day of competition, we will publish the rankings in this section.
fmc: In FMC you have to find the shortest solution to a given scramble in 1 hour of time.
You must not use any electronic device or algorithm sheet.
You can use pen and paper, stickers and up to three 3x3 cubes.
Once you finish your attempt write the solution in the box below. You can do this after the 1 hour time limit since it can take some time.

The ONLY allowed moves are:
  • R, R', R2, Rw, Rw', Rw2
  • L, L', L2, Lw, Lw', Lw2
  • U, U', U2, Uw, Uw', Uw2
  • D, D', D2, Dw, Dw', Dw2
  • F, F', F2, Fw, Fw', Fw2
  • B, B', B2, Bw, Bw', Bw2

The ONLY allowed rotations are:
  • x, x', x2, X, X', X2
  • y, y', y2, Y, Y', Y2
  • z, z', z2, Z, Z', Z2
The maximum number of moves is 80. Anly longer solution will be converted to a DNF.
We will also consider DNF any solution with typing mistakes or forbidden notation. Examples are: L UD F, U3, M (slice moves are NOT allowed), parentheses, etc…

If your solution makes use of advanced FMC techniques, you must provide an explanation in the second box below. Any solution that we can’t understand just by reading it (like a linear cfop solution) will be considered a DNF if not explained.
Here you can find the complete WCA Regulations for any other doubts.
compete.submitMessage: Once the results have been submitted, you will no longer be able to edit them. Double-check the values entered before proceeding.
compete.confirmSubmit: Do you want to submit the results?
compete.alldone: No round available to compete in

login.title: Sign in
desc: To be able to register and compete for the Cubing in Spring 2021 you need a WCA account.
If you haven't got one yet, you can create it by visiting this page.
Once you've created the account, come back here to sign in and register and compete for the Cubing in Spring 2021!

home.title: Home
home.desc: The Cubing in Spring 2021 is the second online competition organized entirely by Cubing Italy!
home.subdesc: This competition is free and open to everybody, the only requirement is knowing how to solve the Rubik's cube!

millionaire.title: Who wants to be millionaire?
whatdesc: It’s our take on the famous tv show “Who wants to be a Millionaire?”: If you answer correctly to 15 increasingly difficult questions you’ll win the prize.
The questions are going to be about Cubing Italy, the WCA, the Rubik’s cube and it’s history.
You will have 4 Lifelines that you can use only once:

• Switch: swap the question with another one about a different topic.
  • 50-50: we will tell you two of the three different topics.
  • Phone Lorenzo Mauro: you will be able to cooperate to answer the question or he can give you the answer directly.
  • Ask the audience: Twitch chat will help you through a poll.
You can only play once. If you are not interested in taking part in the event, you are welcome to join the audience on Twitch. The competitor might need your help!
millionaire.whendesc: Saturday, March 13th from 6 p.m. on our Twitch Channel. If a lot of people want to play and we ran out of time, we can consider continuing from 9 p.m.
howdesc: In order to play you must agree to come live on Twitch with your WEBCAM ON. If you don’t we can’t let you in.
We will set up a Discord voice chat for the queue. Join between 5:45 p.m and 8 p.m. and wait for your turn chatting with the other soon-to-be competitors.
millionaire.prizedesc: Glory, Knowledge, your name in the Hall of Cubing Fame and a voucher for a free competition.
